Desc.entry: Project run by Sheffield City Council Parks and Countryside Ranger Service to tackle community safety in selected green spaces around the city. Aimed at young people aged 12-18 years, to engage them in diversionary activities and restorative justice. Deliver a qualification through ASDAN providing placements for young people of secondary school age around the topic of environmental conservation and improvement.

Address.entry: Parks and Countryside Ranger Service North Team

ContactName.entry: Simon Dore, Ranger Team Leader/Hemendra Headworth/James Smith/James Musgrave, Greenwatch Rangers

ProvisionDaysAndTimes.entry: By prior arrangement, sessions are held in green spaces in Burngreave, Sharrow, Brightside and Shiregreen, Gleadless Valley and other citywide locations
